Description: The disparate impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on communities of color has generated additional attention to the issue of systemic racism and its adverse effects on public health. Panelists in this session are all prominent leaders in oncology and they are also eminent members of important advisory boards that guide the national cancer research agenda. They will discuss their plans for leveraging the power of these agencies to achieve health equity. The advisory boards that will be represented include (i) the Presidentâ€™s Cancer Panel; (ii) the National Academy of Medicine; and (iii) the National Cancer Advisory Board.

Title: Minorities in Cancer Research Scientific Symposium: Opportunities to Leverage Legislation and Policies in Addressing Cancer Disparities
